title: Macbook Pro - M1 Pro showing significant energy usage
content: I have the new MacBook Pro 14" M1 pro. The battery usage is showing as "significant" going from 100% - 55% in about an hour while only using Firefox 94.0.1 the latest update. - what I've tried is deleting Firefox and downloading a fresh copy in case the migrated version had a problem - using Monterey 12.0.1 and 16G of ram. My old 2015 MacBook Pro did not have this problem to the same extent, so for a new high performing and efficient M1 Pro chip to be draining the battery which should run for a working day is indicating a serious problem with Firefox. While the fan has not switched on the Laptop also gets warm which doing very basic internet surfing which should not be taxing enough to heat the whole laptop. Please address this serious problem, many thanks

title: Version 94.0.1 crashes on opening a web page.
content:
Since installing the recent 94.0.1 upgrade (Windows 10), Firefox crashes when I open a web page--any web page that I've tried. When I click "Restart Firefox" on the Crash Reporter popup, it crashes immediately--an endless loop of crash reports. I'm sending this from Chrome because, although Firefox let me get to Mozilla Help, as soon as I went to compose a post, it crashed.

I was already upset about the intentional change to no longer open PDFs in Acrobat. The first change--opening them in a Firefox tab--seems to have met a lot of resistance, so that the first Version 94.0 changed to downloading but not opening them (AND not letting you know that it was downloading them!). I would note that any company that lets me download statements DOES open them in Acrobat--it would be pleasant if Firefox could revert to that standard.

Since I can't use Firefox at all now, I'm taking the opportunity to test out the latest versions of the other top browsers. If one of them suits me, I'll certainly make the change, despite many years of using and advocating Firefox.

title: INCREDIBLY slow to load pages and tab crashes
content:
I have V94.0.1 64 bit version of Firefox. Let me start with this - I really like Firefox and all that it stands for in terms of privacy. I despise Chrome, MSIE/Edge, and Safari because of the data mining they do.

That said, I am very frustrated with Firefox performance on both my Windows PC and my Apple MacBook. I have several pinned tabs. It takes what feels like FOREVER for the pinned and other tabs to open and fully load from the previous session. In fact, some tabs, pinned or not pinned, take easily 15 -20 minutes before they fully load, if they ever load. I also have several tabs that crash all the time - TitanTV, LinkedIn, IMDB, iCloud, Cozi, YahooMail, etc. There are also times where a tab or page gets so hung that I have to close Firefox and start it again. I have uninstalled and reinstalled numerous times. I have not found any useful assistance on this support forum or with general web searches.

Can someone PLEASE help me solve this as it is way beyond annoying?

title: Firefox Account inacessível
content: Solicito ajuda com uma dificuldade de acesso a minha antiga conta firefox sync. Vou resumir a seguir o meu caso: tenho uma conta com a opção de segurança de autenticação em dois fatores ativada e meu app é o Google Authenticator. Tenho ele instalado em um iPad Air2. Recentemente houve a atualização do sistema operacional desse tablet do IOS 14 para o IOS 15. Após esse processo descobri que teria de reconfigurar o meu app de Autenticação do Google porque, por algum motivo que desconheço, todas as contas que já tinha configuradas em autenticação de dois fatores foram foram perdidas e tive de recadastrá-las. Entretanto, a do Firefox Sync eu não consigo porque também perdi minha senha de recuperação. Eu entendo que a negligência foi toda de minha parte. Li as políticas de segurança da Mozilla e entendi que o motivo é que para recuperar esse acesso preciso provar minha identidade, o que não tenho como fazer no momento pelos motivos explicados acima. Então, estou recorrendo a este canal para solicitar que a área de suporte da Mozilla possa excluir minha conta associada ao e-mail juliovarella@gmail.com e todos os respectivos dados. Assim, eu terei a chance de me cadastrar novamente com este meu e-mail (que é meu principal e-mail) pois tenho todo interesse em continuar utilizando o firefox e sincronizando os dados em todos os meus dispositivos. Não tenho problema em perder os dados já armazenados nos servidores da Mozilla, pois possuo backup de tudo. Só preciso mesmo poder me cadastrar com esse e-mail citado e voltar a sincronizar tudo. Para ter algum acesso provisório acabei cadastrando outra conta de e-mail apenas para esse acesso contingencial. Desde já agradeço pela atenção dispensada e conto com o apoio de vocês. Grato!

title: Some Specific Questions About The Safety/Privacy Of The Extensions
content:
I know this look a bit long but please bear with me, I believe I have some answer-worthy questions.

Hello everyone,

I searched the community to find some specific answers but I could not. I am sorry if I missed some content but I don't think so since I think my questions appear to be a bit more specific. These are:

1- Extensions ask for permissions and permissions may access your information according to their descriptions explained on: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/permission-request-messages-firefox-extensions

That's ok but extensions are updated frequently, right? So, can extensions' permission settings be changed via an update? If yes, does firefox inform us that the extension has changed it's permission settings?

I would not like to have an extension having little permissions to be updated to some kind of data recorder without me knowing. (And yes people check these but that's my 2nd question)

2- Yes, (sometimes) people check the updates that are made to certain extensions, in case that's a 'recommended' extension, it is always checked by real people, that's great. But I could not find any information about what would be the aftermath of an extension which changed in a bad way. What happens then? Is it immediately blocked? Does it automatically stop working? Does the safe old version keep working and the new-bad-update never sees the light of the day? That would be great to know.

3- This one is about privacy. Since one of the most important aspects of Firefox is its privacy-friendly design, I wanted to ask if privacy aspects of the extensions are also checked by the community (or Firefox staff in case of 'recommended' extensions). I know, there are some cases that might make you ask: "Not everybody cares about privacy, also not every extension is about privacy, some even clearly state they are bad for privacy, why would something like this be routinely checked?" But there are some extensions that are solely made for privacy. What happens if something about apps privacy policy changes? Or some app that did not collect data beforehand starts to collect data and start to harm our privacy?

I hope these are some legit questions and with some answers they would leave an information-laden thread to the community.

Best Regards
creator: diot_morrocco

title: Reprodução ininterrupta de vídeos.
content: Olá! Sou usuário linux, Ubuntu 20.04.3, Firefox 94.0.1 instalado via pacote snap. Isto ocorria, também com videos de música quando a instalação era por pacote .deb. Agora, por pacote snap, músicas ficam paradas/pausadas, mas vídeos reiniciam após pausa/parar. Não acontece com páginas específicas, mas com todas. Se volto a página "Início" do Youtube, o audio do video que estava assistindo anteriormente volta a tocar.

title: Firefox.exe impossibile trovare punto di ingresso (api-ms-win-crt-private-l1-1-0.dll)
content:
Salve,

dall'ultimo aggiornamento di ieri Firefox mostra il messaggio d'errore segnalato nel topic.

Per poter proseguire occorre dare cancel almeno 5-6 volte e dopo funziona tutto.

Il problema appare solamente alla prima apertura di Firefox.

Ho provato di tutto :

- aggiornamento runtime (e tutto il pacchetto visual) - pulizia e varie procedure di ripristino compreso controllo .dll sfc /scannow - seguito almeno una decina di guide relative al problema sul punto di ingresso

Non posso ripristinare il sistema a 6 gg fa perche' mi dice che c'e' un file in uso (pare che questo errore sia tipico a chi abbia Windows 7)

Comunque, la cosa è seccante perche' fino a ieri andava tutto bene e mi spiace dover abbandonare Firefox per questo problema.

Anticipatamente grazie.

ps : ho provato anche con il pacchetto WindowsUCRT che dovrebbe ripristinare le dll crt ma avendo Win 7 credo che sia inutile e difatti non ha risolto il problema.

Luca
